intro: Secamone bicolor var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
